values: Leaders must ensure individuals who handle ammunition, explosives, and pyrotechnics are trained on proper handling procedures and safety.

Leaders must enforce no smoking except in designated areas.
Have 2x ten (10) pound fire extinguishers on hand.
Separate ammunition points will be established for live and blank rounds. - Separate incompatible lots/types of ammunition and explosives.
Do not transport ammunition and personnel on same vehicle.

draw.overall_supervision_plan: The Troop/PLTs/Sections will receive a safety/convoy brief prior to and from the range.  The range OIC will give a range brief that will discusses all the safety measures and standards of the range. All NCO's with their respective sections will enforce all standards outlined in the DRAW and safety brief. A medic will be on site with a CASEVAC vehicle.  All safeties will also enforce all standards outlined in the DRAW and safety brief. A copy of this signed risk assessment will be maintained in the range books at both ranges. Soldiers conducting the training will be given deliberate classroom instruction, given a written exam, and conduct PMI prior to the date of execution.
